attributes.action: Amend the British Museum Act to allow the acceptance of repatriation requests
attributes.additional_details:
The unlawful removal of the Rosetta stone and other artefacts has been contentious ever since they were removed from their countries of origin. The Rosetta stone represent the part of the history and cultural identity of millions of Egyptian people. The British Museum has said it “needs an act of Parliament” to repatriate them. It is time for Britain to finally cooperate.

Let’s show the world our British sense of fair play by making this gesture of goodwill and friendship.
attributes.background: The return of the Rosetta stone and other artefacts to their countries of origin is a matter for the British Museum. However, in order for the British Museum to be able to accept a request for these artefacts to be repatriated the British Museum Act needs to be amended.

departments.name: Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport
